head.supplied: Lyttleton ¶ 28/6/89. ¶ ¶ […] ¶ ¶ I also take opportunity to state that Baron von Muller has since identified the herbarium specimens of "Cut Tail" as Eucalyptys amygdalina ¶ var ¶ ., as he has don...

div.p: MRS 203, Inwards correspondence — special bundles, 1886-1921 Item 1, 89/218, Archives of the Powerhouse Museum, Sydney.
I also take opportunity to state that Baron von Muller has since identified the herbarium specimens of "Cut Tail" as Eucalyptys amygdalina var ., as he has done four years ago

already. Log, bark and kino from that species I have labelled; Eucalyptus sp . (Cut Tail) but there is one sample of kino I sent per mail some time ago labelled Eucalyptus regnans, Loc Tingiringi Mountain; dated 2/3/89. According to Baron von Mullers determination the specific name will require to be altered. […]

A few weeks ago I sent per mail a small quantity of kino from Brown's Camp, the species of the small tree I obtained it from, I then considered to be a Hybrid of Euc. Gunnii and Euc. viminalis; observation having led me to that opinion. I forwarded herbarium specimens of it at the time to Baron von Muller, but without any particular information, and have now his decision about it, which is to the effect that it is either a Hybrid of E. Gunnii and E. viminalis or a variety of E. viminalis. Observation on the spot confirms my opinion that it is a true Hybrid of the two above mentioned species, and not a mere variety of E. viminalis; […] I have little doubt that Baron von Muller was guided in his determination by those well pronounced young state leaves […]

Last January I forwarded a complete set of specimens of another Eucalypt very prevalent in the Delegate District, to Baron von Muller, but have never recieved
sic.
the determination of it. It is one of the "White Gums"
Marginal note by […]: 'Euc Gunnii. — /10/90. W.B.' […]
Not relevant.
